plugins.name: QR Coder
plugins.description:
Easily generate QR codes in raster or vector.


Just type in any URL or text and the plugin will generate the QR code that you can use your phone camera to scan.


Supported types:

  • Plain text
  • URLs (www.example.com)
  • Email (mailto:example@gmail.com)
  • Phone numbers (tel:+12125551212)


Coming soon!

  • WIFI
  • MECARD


This is also great for creating QR codes to share Figma links.


This plugin is open source. Feel free to open issues/request features or pull requests at https://github.com/nathakits/qr-figma-plugin

plugins.name: Image2Vector
plugins.description:
Introducing Image2Vector, the ultimate plugin that revolutionizes the way you transform low-resolution or pixelated images into high-quality, scalable vector graphics. Whether you're designing logos, illustrations, or anything in between, this plugin seamlessly integrates into your workflow, offering unmatched productivity and ease-of-use.


With Image2Vector, gone are the days of struggling with blurry or distorted images. Simply select any image file, be it a PNG, JPG, or any other format, right within your Figma project. Then, with a single click, let the power of Image2Vector work its magic. Within seconds, your image will be transformed into a meticulously traced vector graphic, preserving every detail with astounding precision.


The speed of Image2Vector is truly unparalleled, ensuring you never have to waste precious time manually redrawing or resizing images. Focus on what you do best - designing - while the plugin effortlessly converts your images into high-quality vectors, ready to be scaled to any size without any loss in quality.


Whether you're a professional designer or a creative enthusiast, Image2Vector is your go-to tool for achieving stunning results. Elevate your designs to new heights, breathe life into pixelated graphics, and unlock limitless possibilities for your projects. Experience the simplicity, speed, and transformative power of Image2Vector and witness your images come to life in the world of vectors.


Support - https://twitter.com/dev_shekhawat
plugins.tagline: Best-in-class raster-to-vector conversion

plugins.name: Marka Email Generator ‚Äì Create Emails in Figma [Outlook, Gmail, iOS]
plugins.description:
markaplugin.com

Documentation

Video tutorials


About

Marka Email Generator exports HTML email templates. Templates work for all common email clients, including Gmail, Apple Mail, Outlook, and others.


You can create an email using ready-made blocks or create your own design from scratch.


The plugin supports two modes Responsive and Breakpoints.


Responsive mode

Mobile version creates automatically based on auto layout and constraints settings of a desktop frame.


Breakpoints mode

In this mode you can design special frame for desktop and mobile.


How to use:

1. Design a frame for desktop and optionally for mobile

2. Run the plugin and preview a template

3. Export an HTML file

plugins.name: Snapshot
plugins.description:
Perspective mockups, synced in a click.

It's the fastest perspective plugin available. üî•


---


Create a Snapshot from any layer, and turn it into an image ‚Äî whilst rotating/flipping it and converting it to the correct perspective all at once.


There‚Äôs a few similar ‚ÄòMockup‚Äô plugins out there; but from my testing, Snapshot is the fastest!

Plus it provides a way to easily ‚Äòre-sync‚Äô any of the Snapshots with a single click in the Inspector pane.


Getting started

  1. Select the layer you want to grab a snapshot of (this can be any layer type) ‚Äî this is known as the 'Source Layer'
  2. Also select the layer you want the Snapshot to be placed into; this must be a layer with four points (Frame, Rectangle, Vector) ‚Äî this is known as the 'Destination layer'
  3. Run Snapshot!
  4. See an instant preview of how it will look ‚Äî and flip/rotate the Snapshot as needed
  5. Click Apply! üéâ


Quickly re-syncing

After you've created a Snapshot once before, now you can re-update it in a click.

To do this, select either the Source or Destination Layer (select just one), and click 'Update Snapshot' in the inspector panel.


---


Mockup Resources

There's some great resources out there to get devices to use for these Snapshots.

Checkout:

  1. LS Graphics ‚Äì Free Figma Mockups
  2. Angle 3 ‚Äì For over 3,100 Vector & 3D device mockups


(If you know any other resources you want on this list, just let me know)


---


If you find this plugin helpful, why not support me by buying me a coffee: buymeacoffee.com/davew ü§ó

accepted.name: Dave Williames
accepted.description: I like to make plugins; and I hope they make your life just a tiny bit easier in Figma ü§ó

plugins.tagline: Perspective mockups, synced in a click.

plugins.name: Free Icon Pack by Iconduck
plugins.description:
Free Icon Pack is an Icon Set of 103 icons. It is exclusively made up of color icons. It's been open sourced with the license: Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal (CC0). All icons can be used for personal & commercial purposes.


While it's a smaller icon set, the design of the 103 icons are professional, consistent, and modern. There's a strong emphasis on:

  • Heart and love icons
  • Travel icons (eg. ships, planes, etc.)
  • Clothing icons (bikinis, shorts, pants, etc.)


These are all part of Iconduck, which is a platform of over 118,894 icons, emojis, flags, clipart and illustrations.


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons or emojis
  • Search through them all instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite icons
  • View your search history
  • View your embed history

plugins.name: Export/Import Variables
plugins.description:
Export variables from one file and import them to another. It's great for migrating libraries, or when you downloaded library from the community and you‚Äôd like to import or update variables in your existing design system.


Supported features

  • All variable types (color, string, number, boolean)
  • Value aliases (when it‚Äôs from the same collection)
  • Variable info (description, scopes, code syntax)
  • Multiple modes
  • Update matching collection (instead of adding a new one)


Instructions

  1. Open plugin in the file with collections that you want to export
  2. Export selected collection to JSON
  3. Open plugin in the file where you want to import variables into
  4. Select or drop collection JSON to plugin
  5. Enjoy the collection in a new file üéâ


Updating existing collection (instead of creating duplicates)

The plugin now allows updating existing collections. If a collection with a matching name exists, you'll have the option to update it instead of creating a new one. The plugin will attempt to match variables and modes based on their names. If a match is found, the plugin will update the values of those variables. If there are non-matching modes or variables, the plugin will create them.


Known limitations

  • References from different collections will get detached. Variable will use correct raw value instead. I plan to add support for cross-referenced variables later.
  • Making changes to your collections in Figma file requires either relaunching the plugin or refreshing the collections.
  • Order of the token gets sometimes exported incorrectly.


This plugin is created by Jan Toman. If you have ideas for improvements, or encounter any issues, please let me know.

accepted.name: Honza Toman
accepted.description: Building future of design systems tooling at Supernova.io. I code-ish.

plugins.tagline: Export variables from one file and import them to another. Supports modes, references, and scopes.

plugins.name: Simple Noise
plugins.description:
Elevate your designs with stunning noise effects using the Simple Noise plugin for Figma. Simple Noise lets you add texture and depth to your designs in just a few clicks.


Simple Noise plugin helps you to quickly and effortlessly create noise with real-time previews. With full control over density, size, and shapes. The plugin also offers an invert option to explore different creative possibilities, and all noise effects are transparent, seamlessly blending with your existing designs.


Features:

  1. Realtime Preview: Experience the power of instant visual feedback as you create noise in Figma. Simple Noise provides a seamless preview of your noise effect, allowing you to make adjustments on the fly.
  2. Density Control: Take full control over the density of your noise effect. Adjust the level of detail by increasing or decreasing the density to achieve the desired texture.
  3. Size Customisation: Easily modify the size of the noise elements to suit your design needs. Whether you prefer fine-grained details or bold, chunky noise, Simple Noise enables you to adjust the size effortlessly.
  4. Shape Selection: Choose from two supported shapes‚Äîsquare and circle‚Äîto customize the appearance of your noise. Each shape offers unique visual characteristics, allowing you to add variation and style to your designs.
  5. Invert Option: Explore creative possibilities by inverting the colors of noise.
  6. Transparent Noise: Every noise effect created with Simple Noise is transparent. This enables seamless integration with your existing designs, allowing the noise to blend naturally with the background or other elements.
plugins.tagline: Simple High Quality Noise Generator

plugins.name: Grayscale
plugins.description:
Convert your designs to grayscale to get more targeted feedback during user testing, evaluate visual hierarchy, signify deprecated designs, and more.


This plugin is non-destructive. A filter layer is added to the canvas above each selected element and can easily be undone.


Supports multi-select on all types of elements, including frames, nested frames, and images.


Steps to use

  1. Select any number of elements on the screen.
  2. Choose "Grayscale Selection" from the plugin submenu.
  3. To undo, select "Remove All Grayscale" from the plugin submenu, ‚åòZ / Ctrl + Z, or manually delete the "Grayscale filter" layers.


Nested component and auto-layout support coming soon.

plugins.name: Beatflyer
plugins.description:
Animate your artboard in a few clicks using several highly configurable hardware-accelerated visual effects. If you add a soundtrack, the effects can be animated using several audio signals.


Other features

  1. Use as the soundtrack a cool royalty-free loop, an audio file of yours, or a sample from the entire Apple Music catalogue (videos containing popular songs might get blocked when shared online).
  2. Add customisable audio visualisations.
  3. Build your design with composition effects and the built-in timeline (check out the stack icon)
  4. Auto-generate captions from audio files and then animate them with cool transition options.
  5. Spice up your video adding animated stickers from Giphy.
  6. Export engaging and optimized animated GIFs.
  7. And much more!


Instructions

Group your layers properly before running the plugin to give the same combination of effects to multiple elements.


Before using it, you might want to look at the intro video.


Enjoy!

plugins.name: Sticky Notes
plugins.description:
Leave notes in your Figma file

You can insert notes one at time by selecting a note colour.

When you run the plugin you can add notes in the following colours: green, red, purple, blue, white, and classic yellow!

----------------
Paste into note
----------------
If you have text that you would like to paste into your file just select "Paste into note" and your text will be added in a yellow note.

Multiple notes can be created when you paste text that has line breaks in it. This makes adding a collection of notes faster from your favourite text editor and/or spreadsheet.

You can also replace text of an existing note by pasting text when you have that note selected. This also works for inserting multiple notes of a specific colour.

---------------
Change colours
---------------
Change the colour of an existing note to another one in the palette by using the "Change colour" command

plugins.name: Propstar
plugins.description:
Generate all possible instances for your components, including every combination of variants and component properties, all in a tidy labelled table.


Creating tables

  1. Select one or multiple components or component sets.
  2. Run Propstar > Create property table.
  3. That's it! A table of instances will be generated behind your component, displaying your main component alongside all possible instances.


Settings

The settings panel allows you to customise several aspects of your property table. Here's what you can do:


  1. By default Propstar saves your settings locally on your computer, but you can change it to remember different settings for each file or each individual component.
  2. Include boolean instances to generate every possible permutation of your component, or disable them to simply organise your component set.
  3. [‚òÖPro] Enable Nested instances to show the properties of exposed nested instances on the table as well.
  4. Toggle Standalone to create your property table separately from your source component.
  5. [‚òÖPro] Customise color, font size, stroke weight, padding, and the opacity that highlights generated instances. Please send a message in the comments if you want to customise other aspects of the table.


Unlock Propstar Pro

Support the development of Propstar by unlocking Pro with a one-time fee of $7.


Ordering

To change the order of instances on the table, reorder the properties and values directly on Figma, using the controls on the right sidebar.


The property values of your default variants are prioritised so that the main components stay on the left, while the generated instances are spread around the rest of the table.


Figma does not currently support mixing the order between variant and component properties.

accepted.name: Henrique Gusso
accepted.description: Design Tooling at Wise

plugins.tagline: Generate every possible instance for your components, all in a tidy labelled table.

plugins.name: Themer
plugins.description:
Themer enables you to create and switch themes from your *published* styles in your team library.


How does it work?

Themer creates themes from sets of styles. Each set of styles should contain styles with the same name. When you make a selection, the plugin will identify styles which have matching names associated with the theme you selected, and apply them all at once; enabling you to do fast theme switches.


Themer uses an external service (jsonbin.io) to store your theme definitions. This enables you to share your configuration with your teammates so that everyone can use the same set of themes. Only the names of your styles, the name of your themes, and a unique identifier for each style is stored in this data.


Watch the setup video on YouTube.


Notes:

  • Your styles must be published to use Themer
  • Your Themer configuration (API Key and Bin URL) will be stored to your Figma client. You may need to re-enter this information if use it on a different device, or move between accessing Figma in the browser and desktop app.

accepted.name: Tom
accepted.description: Digital designer. Designer Advocate @Figma

plugins.name: Storybook Connect
plugins.description:
Embed stories into your Figma workspace to cross-reference the live implementation in one place. Open the Storybook Connect window to start interacting with the real components.


With the Storybook Connect Plugin you can:

  1.  Link design components to stories
  2.  Play with interactive stories in Figma
  3.  Compare implementation to the design


Link components

When you link a component or a variant to a story that link propagates to every instance in Figma. Your collaborators can also see the story link.


Compare implementation to the design

The plugin comes with a compact yet powerful story embed that includes familiar tools like the Outline, Measure, Backgrounds, and more.


Open Storybook from the sidebar

See which components are linked by glancing at the Storybook Connect section in Figma‚Äôs sidebar.


Open Storybook in Dev mode

See which components are linked by glancing at the Storybook Connect section in Figma‚Äôs sidebar


Requires a Chromatic account for access control & security, sign up for free here.


Join the Storybook discord here and visit the #figma-plugin channel for support!

plugins.name: scrollbars
plugins.description:
Easily add accurate horizontal and vertical scrollbars to frames. Works regardless of Auto-Layout settings and calculates all sizing automatically :^)


Simply select a frame with children and run the plugin. If a scrollbar is needed on either axis, it will be added to your frame. (Note that if nothing is out of the bounds of the frame, no scrollbars are needed, so nothing will be generated!) If your content changes, re-run the plugin on your frame (optionally via a shortcut in the properties panel) and the scrollbars will adjust accordingly.


In the future, if requested, I would consider adding a control panel for editing the size/styling of the generated scrollbar and changing initial offsets.


Enjoy!

plugins.name: Lazy Load
plugins.description:
Lazy load lets you generate skeleton loading screens in one click. Now you can save enough time while designing loading screens for developer handoff. 


How to use the plugin?

Select your screen

Run the plugin

Thats it!!


üî• Pro Tips


Want to ignore the background layers from being converted into skeleton?

=> Hide the layer or Reduce opacity to 0% (Shortcut: You can do this by simply pressing 0 twice)


Want to ignore inner button text, icon vector or any child elements of a group or frame?

=> Lock the parent group or frame containing these elements (Shortcut: You can do this by ‚åò+SHIFT+L )


ü§î FAQs


Why are some of the elements in my screen not converted into loader elements?

=> By default the plugin is developed to ignore

  • Layers with 0% Opacity
  • Layers with Disabled Visibility
  • Masked Layers
  • Layers with height/width less than 0.01

128316.name: Physics animation
128316.description:
Imagine if regular layers on Figma could easily transform into dynamic animations with realistic physics. With the Physics Animation plugin, that's exactly what you can achieve! And guess what? You don't need any specialised skills.


You can even effortlessly export your animations in various formats including webm, lottie, gif, and svg.


Video - https://youtu.be/zfxCbgW9NWQ?si=Nc7emHdS9Nk-saPU


To get started, you'll find a wide range of animation templates that seamlessly integrate with the plugin. These templates are a great resource to help you understand how this powerful tool works.


Physics animation doesn't require a subscription, a one-time payment gives full access. Each licence key is tied to one Figma account.


Website - https://davv.store/physics_animation


Questions? Reach out to us: info@davv.store

plugins.name: Visily
plugins.description:
Ideate in Visily. Polish in Figma!

This plugin lets you convert screens and elements created in Visily to fully editable Figma designs.


Features

  1. Export screens in Visily and import them to Figma
  2. Copy screens and elements in Visily and paste to Figma


How to use the plugin?

  1. Design your UI in Visily
  2. Convert to Figma using one of the following methods:


a. Export & Import

  1. In Visily, click "Share" and select ‚ÄúExport to Figma‚Äù
  2. Return to the plugin popup, click the import button


b. Copy & Paste

  1. Select any screens or elements in Visily and press Cmd-C
  2. Return to the plugin popup, press Cmd-V


Why use this plugin?

Visily provides the fastest way for teams to design app wireframes and prototypes. Non-designers can ideate on UI concepts quickly in Visily, then use this plugin to hand-off their work to designers for final polishing in Figma.


About Visily

Visily is the easiest wireframe software, enabling teams of all sizes and skill levels to create stunning wireframes and prototypes at lightning speed. With its intuitive interface, extensive UI library, and advanced AI features, Visily has helped thousands of teams iterate and validate ideas quickly and efficiently.


Follow Us

Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn | Instagram | TikTok | YouTube

plugins.name: Super PDF
plugins.description:
Super PDF is your all-in-one plugin for import, export, merge, and viewing PDF files directly within Figma and FigJam. Experience super-fast performance and high-quality results, whether you're designing, reading, or combining frames and sections into a single PDF file. Free and private.


Import mode

Effortlessly drag and drop (or click to select) multiple PDF files using Super resolution. Perfect for integrating external documents into your design workflow in super quality. That's it. Check settings to customize your preferences in Figma and FigJam.


Export mode

Seamlessly select frames, sections, or other design elements to merge into a single, high-quality PDF. Ideal for creating presentation slides and comprehensive documentation. Export as single combined PDF file from your selections.

Sort pages by time created, name (alphabetically) or by number. Exporting PDFs in super high quality perfect for presentation slides and documentation.


Reader / viewer mode

Instantly open and view PDF files within Figma and FigJam with Super resolution, ensuring clarity and precision.


Plugin features

Free for Figma and FigJam: Enjoy all features at no cost.

Super Fast Import: Auto-import multiple PDF files with Super resolution.

High-Quality Export: Combine frames into a single PDF file with exceptional quality and reduced file size.

Fast PDF Viewer: View and read PDFs with Super resolution.

Accurate and Reliable: Ensure high quality and accuracy for every PDF file.

Easy to use: Customize Settings to your preference.

Analytics Tracking: Monitor your PDF imports, exports, and reader usage.


Get in touch

Leave a comment here, send an email to support or reach out to @titanas for any questions and requests.


Your data stays with you

100% private. No file upload to servers. No network access. No tracking. No back-end.


Plugin analytics are stored locally and only you have access to it. That means if cache is cleared or the plugin is uninstalled, analytics will be deleted and lost.

plugins.name: Bullets
plugins.description:
Create custom bulleted lists using components and save reusable bullet styles on your file.


NOTE: The plugin doesn't support the native Figma bullet styles. The intended behavior is to create a single instance layer for each list item.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


‚òû HOW TO CREATE A BULLET STYLE


1. Create a Figma component with your preferred design for the bullet. Make sure to set Scale as constrain on the all component's children; The bullets instances on the list will inherit the size of this component, you may want to adjust its dimension according to your scenario.


2. Select the bullet component and click the plus icon on the plugin panel to save it as bullet style;


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


‚òû HOW TO APPLY A BULLET STYLE


1. Select at least one or more layers;


2. Click one of the bullet styles available to add one bullet instance for each selected layer on the canvas. The plugin will organize your layers into a list using Figma Auto-Layout.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


‚òû HOW TO APPLY CHANGES TO THE BULLETS


1. Select the bullets instance layers via the new quick-select feature or manually.


2(A) - You can swap bullets by clicking on a different bullet style via on the plugin.


2(B) - You can change size of the bullets or the auto-layout spacing and alignment via the built-in Figma interface.


‚ùß

plugins.name: Device Models
plugins.description:
Create mockups with 3D device models. Customize the color, camera angle, and device model for your mockups. Includes models for the iPhone, Macbook Pro, iMac, and iPad with more models on the way for other devices.


How to use:


1. Run Device Models from the plugin menu


2. Choose a device model


3. Select any layer to render it on the device's screen. For best results select a layer that's close to the device's screen dimensions (or the same aspect ratio). If it's not exact that's fine, images will be placed similar to Figma's 'Fill' setting for image fills. To create a frame with the right dimensions click the "Create Empty Frame" button.


4. To change the camera angle select an angle preset or click and drag over the device. Alternatively, you can set an exact rotation in degrees on the right. You can also modify the rotation of the model itself there.


5. Choose a device color. If you have local color styles click the color swatch to choose one, or manually enter a hex code.


6. Click "Save as Image" to render the current view as an image layer in Figma.

accepted.name: Cody Bennett
accepted.description: Multidisciplinary designer & developer with a focus on motion and user experience.

plugins.description:
Elevate your designs with 'Doodle Arrows' - the ultimate collection of hand-drawn arrow doodles. This plugin offers a diverse array of arrow styles, from playful curves to dynamic swooshes, perfect for guiding viewers through your creative projects.


Simple to use, just click on a doodle thumbnail to seamlessly insert it into your Figma canvas.

Customize colors and stroke widths to match your design scheme.


Whether it's for an infographic, user interface, or presentation, 'Doodle Arrows' adds a touch of personality and clear direction to your visuals.
plugins.tagline: A collection of hand-drawn doodle arrows

91579.release_notes:
Super fast rendering: Experience swift and seamless insertion of doodle arrows.

Color customization: Easily change the color of your arrows using the built-in color picker.

Adjustable stroke width: Customize the width of your arrows for better visibility and design coherence.

Live preview: See real-time updates in the preview pane as you adjust color and width settings.
